intro: Phyllactis rigida, commonly known as the rigid phyllactis, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically orange or yellow in color. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a woody stem and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Phyllactis rigida is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience to drought conditions.
